response_parsed.title: Documenting Batch Jobs Using FastAPI in Python 3.12+
response_parsed.summary: This guide explains how to document batch jobs using FastAPI, a modern web framework for building APIs in Python 3.12+.
key_points: FastAPI supports asynchronous and synchronous routes by default.
FastAPI has excellent built-in support for OpenAPI 3.0 documentation generation.
Batch jobs can be handled using FastAPI's dependency injection system to manage long-running tasks.

code_examples.code:
from fastapi import FastAPI, Depends
app = FastAPI()
async def long_running_task(): # Your long-running task implementation here

@app.get('/batch', response_model=None)
def batch(dep: dep_obj = Depends(long_running_task)): pass

version_notes: This tutorial is specifically tailored for Python 3.12+ to leverage its improvements in performance, async/await syntax, and other features.
caveats: Batch jobs can impact the responsiveness of your FastAPI application if not properly managed.
Ensure that long-running tasks are run asynchronously, ideally using threads or processes to avoid blocking the event loop.
